articles.author: Sara Moniuszko
articles.title: Even one alcoholic drink per day is linked to higher blood pressure, American Heart Association analysis finds - CBS News
articles.description: Even in adults without hypertension, routinely drinking alcohol is associated with an increase in blood pressure, according to a new research analysis from the American Heart Association.
articles.content:
Routinely drinking alcohol — as little as one drink a day — is associated with an increase in blood pressure readings, even in adults without hypertension, according to new research analysis.
